review.reviewBody: Very warm shirt.  Purchased a Large knowing that it would fit a little tight (40" chest, 33' waist, 153 lbs- I wear XL in the Giordano Silverline thermal jersey which I love too). Works well under a thermal long sleeve jersey or under a long sleeve base. Have ridden with it on in 45-50 degree temps. Very pleased with its performance and highly recommend.
review.name: Great base layer!

review.reviewBody: I own and use Assos, Craft, Showers Pass, and other Giordana base layers.  I bought this base for the cooler seasons and it is excellent.  Extremely comfortable, disappearing after you put it on. Length is good, fit is true. I am 5' 10", 175#, 40 chest, 32 waist, wearing a large. I perhaps could wear a medium but the large fits snug and is not restrictive.  As for temperature range, I have worn the base in 50 to 55 degree weather with an Assos Spring/Fall long sleeve jersey and had no core issues. I have worn in the 40's with a beefier jacket and again no issues.  I have not used this in warmer weather yet -- will have to give it a try as the company says it can pull double duty.  This has become my favorite base for cooler temps; I am getting the long sleeve version for the colder days when more arm protection is needed.
review.name: Excellent base

review.reviewBody:
I haven't tried this yet for the warm rides, too scared to try, though the company says otherwise.
But it does make an excellent S/S base for cool and cold weather rides.  Going into my third winter with this and it remains my favorite base layer of all time.  I also like the crew neck as it's not another layer fighting for space around the neck when bundling up with a jacket and neck warmer (or an added L/S base).  Wicking properties are excellent.
You'll never regret this purchase.
review.name: Excellent cold weather protection

name: Ceramic Short-Sleeve Baselayer - Men's

review.itemreviewed: TX4 Evo Mid GTX Approach Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I totally love these boots! I am an avid rock climber so I like to have the climbing rubber on the sole even when just hiking. They do run very small. I wear a 9 1/2 - 10   After a return of the size 10 I wound up with an 11 and they fit perfectly. Definitely go a full size up
review.name: Great boots

review.itemreviewed: TX4 Evo Mid GTX Approach Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Im a woman, and I prefer a shoe with ankle support and the mens color. So after reading the reviews from the men and trying the shoe myself.. I can see how their complaints of the shoe being stiff and narrow as valid. Probably wouldnt suggest for men. But for WOMEN and as a size 43 (US 10 in womens) with a narrow foot I think its a good approach shoe. The ankle can be tight if you tighten the straps but can be solved if you loosen it. Hiked 5miles on incline up and down and felt good.
review.name: Great for women

review.itemreviewed: TX4 Evo Mid GTX Approach Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought these to replace my old pair (original tx4 mid gtx). They are narrower and extremely painful to wear. Tried multiple sizes. The shoe is also a lot stiffer, I cant imagine climbing in them. No longer an approach shoe but an uncomfortable hiking boot.
review.name: Very painful

review.itemreviewed: TX4 Evo Mid GTX Approach Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This would have been my 5th pair of tx4's (3rd of the mid). I'm sorely disappointed in La Sportiva for changing the fit of one of the most beloved pieces of alpine (and everyday) footwear.

If you're considering these based on your previous experience (fit) then I DO NOT recommend. The new Evo is a bit stiffer (welcome change), but somehow La Sportiva managed to make a shoe with a sloppy heel cup and a cramped (narrow) toe box. Great for all those wide heeled, skinny toed alpinists out there.
review.name: Changed fit from previous tx4

name: TX4 Evo Mid GTX Approach Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Like putting a 30 year old pair of Hanes tighty whiteys on your head. Loose and paper thin. Will make a good handkerchief.

review.reviewBody: Nice and thin and can be warn under other layers. Biggest flaw is that is very short in length and doesn't cover my ears and is hard to keep on the head when moving around.

review.reviewBody:
Believe the reviews that this is just not a good hat. It is way too thin and barely does anything. Im bald, so I know hats. 
Even wearing it inside a cold house you can feel the cold still on your head.
I prefer the slightly less expensive icebreaker hat. 
It does seem to run on the larger side of one size fits all.
review.name: Believe the reviews. Hat sucks

review.reviewBody:
I can't believe they charged $25 for these. I love all SmartWool products and have many many but this is not something I will enjoy. Doesn't fit well. Extremely thin. Nothing that I would consider a Smartwool characteristic. 

Not recommended.
review.name: Not impressed

review.reviewBody: The fabric is warm while offering plenty of flex and movement. I beat my gear up and these have performed admirably for the first season. I used this primarily for backcountry ski days and did the Grand Traverse in them. I like the side vents as my legs sweat but I cut out the mesh in the middle for better breathabiity. I also removed the suspenders. The waste band straps for tightness are velcro and while they hold decently well, it feels like the waste has stretched out over the season.
review.name: Great fit overall. I did make a couple alterations

review.reviewBody: Super lightweight, waterproof and the versatile. I have used these resort skiing, cold weather hiking and plan to use them touring this season.
review.name: Great pair of versatile pants

review.reviewBody: I did not buy these for mountaineering. I bought them for downhill skiing. I was not disappointed. The fit, finish and execution is beyond my expectations. A high quality garment I would recommend to anyone desirous of a good fitting, durable and fashionable lower. Whether beginner or expert, you will arrive in style. Order true to size and don't expect to be waterproof. For best performance combine with a wool layer and plenty of stoke.
review.name: Blown away.

review.reviewBody: Fit great I did size up to the 36 but the the traps worked perfect, wore them touring and loved them . Soft shell but warmth was great
review.name: Amazing pants

review.reviewBody: Great pants, very durable, breathes well, fits over my knee brace.  Used for ski touring and ice climbing.  Gaiters work great, very adaptable.

These pants are so versatile.  Legs adjust out for ski boots or back in for climbing and hiking. Gators are also adjustable and actually work.   Vents are big and functional.  Pockets are perfect for use with harness.  They keep me dry and warm.  Have used them with just a base layer to 20 degrees.  Mammut is quickly becoming my favorite brand.  Quality is top notch.
review.name: Best pants I have used

review.reviewBody: Phenomenal performance once again from Mammut gear. These things are stretchy yet robust, and great to climb in. Surprisingly even in wet conditions, they are super repellent. Definitely a slim fit though, size up unless you like a tight bum
review.name: Brilliant climbing pant, already recommending  these to people

review.reviewBody: Hope Mammut continues to make this soft shell pant. Used mainly for cold weather rock climbing. Fit is trim and has a lot of stretch.
review.name: Great fit. Great overall design and quality.

review.reviewBody:
Proof that full on goretex is over-kill. These have kept me dry and warm on drippy ice climbs & wet ski days. 

Side zips in a softshell are a godsend. Another plus for them being mesh, nothing falls into them. I run quite warm, so they are fantastic for skinning & approaches.

Calf cuffs are well thought out. Was very happy with how tight they can be synched down for climbing. I used to wear one pair of pants for climbing, one for skiing - these handle both quite well.

https://vpo.ca/topic/VPO.Content.Bottoms.M.Mammut?contentonly=true

Study this fit chart and take your measurements. Normally a 35-36 inch waist gives me the room I need for my gigantic ass & thighs. 38 inch waist was perfect for those areas. Unfortunately, they won't stay on my waist without without the suspenders, but that's more of a me issue - not design. Recommend sizing up if you are in doubt
review.name: Best pants around for winter mountaineering

review.reviewBody: Very waterproof, I have stood under a dripping waterfall and stayed dry while ice climbing. They sacrifice a little warmth for movement but still wind proof and warm enough.

name: Eisfeld Guide SO Pant - Men's

comment: Thank you for your feedback. Im very sorry to hear you didnt receive your order. Ive reached out to you directly to help resolve this.

review.reviewBody: Came in handy when my friends dog decided to stop walking on a hike!
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: Yep it happened! Im so paranoid about my dogs health and safety that I purchased the Airlift in medium for my 50 pound Cattle Dog crossbreed. At 2 years old she is an avid experienced hiker. While hiking we ran across a Western Diamond Back Rattlesnake in a rock outcropping. Its rattle was faint then not when it struck at me. I was able to stumble out of the way and not get bitten myself but my dog, who had already cleared the area off leash came back and got between me and the snake. She got nailed! We both got clear of the snake and I examined her. She was bitten on the right jaw. I administered a gelcap Benadryl and water, excitedly deployed the Airlift system got her into it and on my back (we had previously practiced) and my 15 pound daypack onto my chest and hiked up 1.5 miles gaining around 1000 feet of elevation. Walked about another mile on a road where we flagged a truck who took us to my car. We live just below where we were hiking so I was able to get her to the Emergency Veterinary Hospital in just a little over 2 hours from being bitten. Im not a big strong guy. No way I carry a 50 pound dog 4+ miles (without the ride). But I did carry her 2.5 miles+ with the system and thats what Im focusing on. I believe the Airlift system is the reason she survived! And, of course, the fantastic Emergency Vets and 4 vials of anti venom. If you hike with a dog you need this system. The cost is nothing compared to the life of your 4 legged companion and friend!!
review.name: Rattlesnake Bite

review.reviewBody: I purchased this to help carry our old girl (65lb lab) up and down stairs. She was very calm, but it seemed to hurt her back and hips, and she cried out when being picked up. It didnt seem like it balanced her weight well, and didnt seem very secure. We tried several different methods. It was easier on her just to carry her. We have a small portable litter for hiking.  It is heavy for backpacking, and requires 2 people to haul a dog, but it works better than this sling for our situation. Because of her age, we arent backpacking too far, so Im sure it would work on a younger dog, but Im unsure if they had an injury (unless just an extremity) how it would be tolerated.
review.name: Didnt help our old girl

review.reviewBody: Thanks to the Fido Pro Airlift, I was able to carry my 50 lb dog down a steep, rocky trail near my home! Its a trail we frequent, but Sadie injured her paw and wouldnt move. It was late, and I was able to carry her to the car before it got dark.
review.name: Home safe before dark

review.reviewBody: Purchased this prior to backcountry carrying the product, and I tried a couple different sizes before I found the right one for my pup (65lb GSD-Lab-Pit mix), and ended up with the XL size, because her body is long(ish) and the  M/L sizes were pulling her legs forwards and back and seemed to be missing support on the front/back ends. Consequently I had to alter/sew the sling myself to make it the right size (since was too big in other dimensions) and I had to shorten/change the location of the lifting straps and chest strap because I am 5'2" and even at the shortest dimensions all around she was basically sitting below my lower back curve (which is where the dog needs to fit into in order to carry them for any distance) as well as running into my legs.  There is no way that I could carry her for a long time over very rough terrain, but it at least provides some help to get to a better place, and hopefully I could find others in the process if I am otherwise solo. Definitely practice with it and realize that there is going to be a fair amount of strenght required, especially if your dog is heavier.
review.name: Great to have, but may need alterations!

review.reviewBody: My dog injured his paws while hiking a 14,000 ft peak. Im so glad I bought an Airlift rescue sling. I was able to carry him safely back to the car. It was a lot of work but without the sling, theres no way I would have been able to carry him. I would suggest buying the shoulder padding if you have a large dog. The product worked as advertised and is built very solid.
review.name: Injured Paws!

review.reviewBody: I am a woman with a small frame but fit. My boyfriend and I bought this for our trail runs and hikes with our German Shepard mix. We often travel through rattle snake country. Our dog is close to 90 pounds! For me its too much weight to carry for a long period but I still carry the Airlift with me so I have a tool to solicit help from others with. My boyfriend can carry our dog confidently over rough terrain and actually had to use the airlift a few months ago when our dog got a bad cactus thorn wedged in his paw! The Airlift worked well. My boyfriend was pretty exhausted when he got home but got our baby home safe for a little paw cleaning and thorn removal. We have the size XL.  5 stars ALL the WAY! Great product!
review.name: Simple yet wonderful!!

review.reviewBody: I bought my fido pro sling about a year ago, before backcounty started carrying them. I practiced in our yard (we live in the mountains so I thought it a good test). I am a woman at just over five feet tall. I was able to lift (with the help of pulling up on a tree to stand) and carry our 70lb, pound-mutt. I was very pleased that I could walk through terrain with Chaco on my back! As I was searching for a gift for my sister, I noticed you are now carrying fido pro. I am going to purchase one for her and her dog. Totally pleased that I have a way to rescue my dog if necessary.
review.name: Works great for me and my doggo!

review.reviewBody: Extremely disappointed in the omission of pertinent information on this product.  As an avid solo backpacker regularly playing in the Rockies with large dogs, it was due time to invest in a product that would help in an unfortunate emergency. I am grateful we tried this out beforehand to know its useless for my body. As a once female collegiate basketball player and consistent weightlifter, there is no way-even with adrenaline-I would be able to lift my dog from a kneeling position to then being on one knee to standing. I ordered a medium which was well within the weight limits of our puppers (60 lbs). Even with my spouses help, the lift wasnt possible. Only males are featured on the available product images; however, I dont know a female or male in our network that could make this lift for a larger dog. Additionally, the straps dig in to your shoulders (skin scraping) but it seems inconsiderate to charge an additional $25 for ONE shoulder pad rather than include the padding to help an owner in a distressing situation. TLDR: not for the average person, not for large dogs, strap upgrade is nickel and diming the consumer, it is compact and packable, will be returning and continuing the search.
review.name: Not for large dogs

When to the website and read the description and reviews and purchased three in different colors. They are my new favorite button up shirts. The colors are beautiful, the fit was perfect, and the material is dreamy comfortable.

review.reviewBody: I love the light weight and feel of this shirt! I bought it to bring as a sun layer on vacation, when I want to cover my shoulders after a lot of time in the sun. The loose fit is perfect for that. It will go well with a range of different outfits. The winter green color is exactly as pictured, a slightly muted true green. The sleeves are long and loose, and I like that I can easily roll them for a slightly different look. It is also pretty wrinkle resistent, making it a great for travel!

review.reviewBody: This is the worst designed seat post clamp ever.  I should have taken the warning from my LBS seriously.  My LBS would not even take the time to put on.  They said too much of a PIA.  They were right. It requires two people to get a saddle attached.  Finally got one but I took back off. Going to return it. I don?t want a seat post that required this much effort.
review.name: Under no circumstances should you buy
comment: I have the carbon WCS One-Bolt version with a zero offset. Coming from a 3T Doric seatpost where I had to adjust two separate screws independently of each other in order to affect the proper tilt angle (i.e. making one bolt tighter than the other), this seatpost is one of the easiest seatpost I've ever encountered. It took literally no effort to install by myself and it hasn't slipped in the last 500 miles. Make sure you have the proper clamp for your rail system (round vs. oval rails), use carbon paste as necessary, and loosely install the clamping mechanism onto the saddle rails while the saddle is off the bike. As the clamp isn't tight, you can then slide the clamp/saddle assembly onto the semi-circular head from either the front or the rear. Sliding the clamp/saddle fore and aft will impart the desired angle. From here, just torque the single bolt to 12 N-m. It couldn't be any easier and a second person would just get in the way.

I have the alloy version of this seatpost and really like it.   I found it relatively easy to fit my saddle to the post and once all of the pieces are in place, it is very easy to position the saddle.  One bolt and it is easily accessible.  I would suggest assembling the saddle to the post with the post removed from your frame.  I can see how it would be a little tricky to put the post in the frame first.

I have two of these posts. Yes, they can be tricky to mount, but by backing out the mount screw to the very edge, I was able to slide the seat into the mount front first and get it into the rail mounts. I love this seat post. Once the saddle is on, it is infinitely adjustable and it is lighter than anything else you can find at the $200 price point.

name: WCS Carbon 1-Bolt Seatpost

review.itemreviewed: Classic Mini Suede Platform Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these boots. I have never owned UGGS before and did not consider myself an UGG person, but these boots have changed me! They are the best. I live at 8,000 feet and wear these inside as slippers. I also wear them to the gym before I change into my gym shoes, and I have even worn them camping around the fire. The platform adds a nice stylish element that I'm obsessed with. I am usually a 8.5-9 in shoes, and I got the 9. Get these...you won't regret it!
review.name: The best!

review.itemreviewed: Classic Mini Suede Platform Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I have been on the fence about getting These, as I was once on the UGG Train in 2006 (dark times, no water proofing, crumpled, yikes).
But now that I am all grown up I decided to get these. Due to the Lining being wool and super plush, THEY WIL BE TIGHT WHEN YOU PUT THEM ON FOR THE FIRST TIME. They WILL STRETCH OUT THE MORE YOU WEAR THEM. SO please, save yourself the sadness and loss of money and get they tighter fit. They were pretty tight upon trying them on, the toe box and heel were very snug. I am usually a 6.5 or 7 in women's. But Uggs does not make half sizes. So I went with the size 6 and I am so glad that I did. After wearing them for 2 hours around the house after treating them, they molded to my feet and fit perfect.
review.name: Do not size up!

review.itemreviewed: Classic Mini Suede Platform Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These feel great, lightweight soft and comfortable, the fit perfect my foot does not slip at all in this boot like others have said. A must buy!
review.name: Really comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Classic Mini Suede Platform Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: This boot is so cute I HAD to get both colors!! Girl, don't hesitate, & I'm a 6 1/2 I got a 6 and they fit like a beautiful warm glove!! Highly recommend for this fall and winter season!! She will NOT disappoint!! Xoxo My Uggs!!
review.name: Yaaasss!!

review.itemreviewed: Classic Mini Suede Platform Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I received the boots and it looks like they have been previously tried on by someone else. It was also a stain on the boots as if someone tried to clean the suede. They have dents throughout the boots
review.name: These boots look like someone worn these and returned them.

review.itemreviewed: Classic Mini Suede Platform Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The Uggs were too big and when I went to exchange them for a size down they said they couldn't do it.

review.itemreviewed: Classic Mini Suede Platform Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The heel is not reinforced. That means when you stand in these platforms the part where your heel is compressed more than where your toes are, because all your weight is over your heels (and I'm only 120lbs). Therefore your toes wind up higher than your heels. I've waited years to buy these and I love the look but walking in them is like walking in sand.
review.name: Disappointed

review.itemreviewed: Classic Mini Suede Platform Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These booties are so adorable for fall. I got the smallest size (5 ladies) and my ankles wobble because the boot runs at least a size and a half larger than traditional Ugg sizes. But I'm keeping them no matter how many pairs of socks I need to wear with them! Haha
review.name: Runs very large but cute

review.itemreviewed: Classic Mini Suede Platform Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I absolutely LOVE these UGGS, the color is FIRE they feel amazing! Can't wait to wear them this winter
review.name: I want these in every color !

review.itemreviewed: Classic Mini Suede Platform Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I wear a size US 9.5, got the 42s and was a bit nervous because some people said it might be a good idea to upsize but the 42s fit perfect. Best feeling slipper Ive ever had, you can tell theyve been making the soles for a long time because they feel awesome. 
I dont wear slippers too often but theyre nice to have when I want to and I hope they last for a while because theyre the only slipper I can see myself purchasing. Happy with these slippers for sure.
review.name: They feel awesome.

review.reviewBody:
As a firm believer in the power of Birkenstocks I figured I would give the Zermatts a shot. Here's a list of my pros and cons.

Pros: 
- Comfort... super super comfy and soft, not a scratchy wool by any means
- Material... my feet run hot by design but since these are wool, I don't get the stink I would get out of another lined slipper
-  Durability... I wear these to work at the Boulder shop all the time, throw em' on for apres, and toss them around and they haven't shown any points of weakness
- Fit... true to size of a normal burk. I normally wear a 10.5/11 shoe and I got these in a 43. Don't have to deal with poking holes in the straps because the wool holds its shape :) 

Cons: 
- The only con is that these do not have the super thick cork base that you get from a normal burk. That said, I wouldn't count on the orthopedic benefits that your typical burk provides. 

Overall, the Zermatts are a stylish + comfy way to keep the house cleaner, drive back from the resort, or throw on for some errands!
review.name: Best Post Ski/House Slipper Out There

name: Zermatt Shearling Lined Slipper - Men's

description: Buy the Wahoo Fitness KICKR HEADWIND Fan online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: KICKR HEADWIND Fan
hasVariant.description: Buy the Wahoo Fitness KICKR HEADWIND Fan online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Surprisingly strong, with handy app integration. So quiet that I've accidentally left it running after a workout. Very highly recommended!
review.name: Surprisingly strong, with handy app

review.reviewBody: The fan works fine. I was disappointed to learn that it does not support Bluetooth heart rate monitors, only ANT+. DCRainmaker said years ago in a review that BLE connectivity was coming. It never did and I should have paid more attention.
review.name: Only supports ANT+ connections

review.reviewBody:
I like how the fan speed can be controlled by HR or speed. The speed feature is far from perfect since it currently can only be paired with the trainer, and that machine doesnt actually know your virtual speed. Instead it relies on cadence so if youre going downhill in Zwift for instance, the second you stop pedaling the fan thinks youve stopped. 

It would be better if the fan could be paired with the training app youre using and could pull speed from there.
review.name: Nifty but not perfect

review.reviewBody: This has made indoor training so much more enjoyable. I generally keep it connected to my HR monitor and not my speed, and it's really helped manage what is usually a less enjoyable part of indoor training. Sure, you could buy any fan, but for some reason, feeling the air movement as it correlates to my HR has helped me ride longer.
review.name: Indoor Training Must Have

review.reviewBody: Awesome fan! I love that it can be turned up or down on the app so you dont have to unclip to adjust it when youre in the middle of a workout.
review.name: Best fan for a sweaty trainer session!

review.reviewBody: I love this fan. I can place it so it's at the perfect angle for my peloton bike workout. I control it from my phone on the handlebars. I couldn't be happier.
review.name: Great fan!

review.reviewBody: I just got this a couple of weeks ago and at first I was very excited about it, until I realized that it doesnt want to switch between modes. I can not freely switch on the app from speed to manual for instance, it got stuck on speed and wouldnt get out so now I can only push the buttons manually on the fan. Rather disappointing at this price point!! Also, the fan is not as strong as I thought.
review.name: Rather disappointing for this price point.

review.reviewBody: Has made all the difference in the world in my trainer rides. Absolutely great!!!
review.name: Has made all the difference

review.reviewBody: The KICKR Headwind bluetooth fan I received was used and broken out of the box. This is completely unacceptable.
review.name: Shipped Used and Broken KICKR Headwind

review.reviewBody: Holy airflow the difference between to that and my Dyson fan - went from a huge puddle to almost nothing - set it to work with my HR monitor and works easily. Now time indoors is cooler and rides are longer - also isnt noisy - can hear my playlist loud and clear.
review.name: Fantastic

name: KICKR HEADWIND Fan

description: Buy the Giordana FR-C Pro Bib Knicker - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: FR-C Pro Bib Knicker - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Giordana FR-C Pro Bib Knicker - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These definitely run small, so it might be a good idea to size up. They are very comfortable, and I love the mesh over the knee. Highly recommended.
review.name: Great Quality Bibs

review.reviewBody:
I am typically a small in cycling gear. I am in between sizes on the Giordana size chart so I picked size small thinking it would stretch. I could barely pull these up over my hips. The description mentions: "Brushed interior provides warmth and next-to-skin comfort." The fabric did not feel warm to me. 
For reference, I have Giordana's Silverline Thermal Bib Knicker in size small and they fit perfectly!
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, cool and great but the elastic in the mesh knee area doesn?t hold up. Mine look like an old worn out bathing suit. All the little elastics are broken and it looks really bad. The rest of the knickers are still in great shape. If they didn?t look so bad and be so bagged out in the knees I would still be able to use them.
review.name: Good but?.

review.reviewBody: I love the fit.  The material is not thick, but keeps me warm anyway.  The knicker stays in place, so there's no need to stop and adjust.  I don't feel overheated. My rides are typically in the fifty-degree range, which for my personal comfort, works well.  I am sure, however, that I could do a forty-something degree ride and still stay warm enough.  I bought several pairs this fall and I'm still happy with them as winter and cooler morning temperatures arrive!
review.name: Great Knickers!

name: FR-C Pro Bib Knicker - Women's

description: Buy the Thule Thule Subterra Hybrid Travel Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Thule Subterra Hybrid Travel Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Thule Subterra Hybrid Travel Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was so excited to receive this bag!  I have a backpack I use for travel, but Ive been wanting a more streamlined bag.  This backpack can be used like a briefcase, backpack, or as a carry-on that slides into your suitcase.  Its perfect!
When I received the bag, I initially felt disappointed because it was setup in its briefcase format, and i did not see the backpack straps.  When I realized the straps were tucked away in the back zipper compartment, I was happy again!
Im a small female (50), so finding a bag that doesnt overwhelm my frame is important.  This bag is the perfect size.  Not too big, not too small.  It also looks good on my partner; who is 16 inches taller than me.
There is plenty of room in this bag for my laptop, docking station, 184747 million cords, and various chargers on one side and a small bag with personal hygiene necessities on the other side.  For fun, I folded up a small outfit and was able to fit that in the bag with everything else.  If you are a gifted packer or you have a small bag of essentials and clothes, you can take that as well!  My partner said he would easily be able to fit hygiene items and a dress shirt in the bag in addition to work/computer items.
review.name: Sophisticated low profile backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Thule Subterra 2 convertible carry-on bag is an absolute essential for any traveler, combining a sleek design with adaptable features. Its versatility allows you to carry it like a duffel over your shoulder or as a backpack with stowable straps. The removable laptop attach adds convenience and protection for your tech gadgets. Additionally, the fold-flat divider panel inside the main compartment provides organization options for separating items. The bag's design is both iconic and environmentally conscious, as it is made from bluesign certified materials. Features like the water bottle pocket, back panel security pocket, and quick-access front pocket make it incredibly functional. With high-quality construction and compliance with carry-on requirements for most airlines, this bag is an excellent choice for any traveler seeking both style and functionality.
review.name: "Versatile and Stylish: Thule Subterra 2 Convertible Carry-On Bag Review"

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Subterra 2 Hybrid Travel Bag is a great investment for young professionals. The material on the bag feels durable. From work commuting to traveling internationally, you can feel comfort that your items are secured and safe. 

Speaking of safety, I really appreciate that my MacBook fits perfectly in the bag, I don't even need to use its own cover. Also, the bag straps having magnets to close are great (it feels nice whenever I use it as a brief case). 

Overall, this product is great! I'm going to start using this for my work commutes and trips.

I received this product for reviewing purposes.
review.name: The ultimate multi-purpose bag is here!

name: Thule Subterra Hybrid Travel Bag

review.reviewBody: Great design. Very well made. Just the right size for day hikes. Can hold snacks or lunch & water & layered clothing.
review.name: I think I will get many years of use out of it

review.reviewBody: I don't think the photo for this product is correct. There is a middle pocket that you can't see that is only secured closed by a hook and that hook does not stay. I wouldn't recommend sadly.
review.name: Hook pocket is not helpful

review.reviewBody: Perfect day hiker, used at Yosemite - the colors are beautiful.
review.name: My Go to

review.reviewBody: This trail backpack is literally perfect! Perfect size (fits more than you think), lightweight, lots of compartments, LOVE the easy access front pockets on the straps for my phone and sunglasses (truly ingenious design there!!), water bladder sleeve, big enough to fit some layers, snacks for me and my dog, and other hiking essentials. I live in the mountains and do a lot of day hikes and have been searching for months for a new pack and this one exceeds all needs/expectations!
review.name: The PERFECT day pack!! I've been searching for months!

review.reviewBody: I used it for flying, it was light and I put quite a bit in it. What I didn't care for was the one side with no zipper, just a hook. I had to put my wallet in the side and was worried it would fall out or be easy to steal. All in all, I really like my day bag!!
review.name: Yes I would buy it again

review.reviewBody: This is my perfect pack for light hikes. Has multiple pockets which comes in handy to keep my different trail items. I like that I can easily secure my hiking sticks when I don't need them.
review.name: Great day pack

review.reviewBody: The wife wanted to treat herself after losing over 100 pounds and wanted to try out a more versatile hiking pack. So far She loves it. Super comfy and breathable material ! the straps are very generous and comes with an expandable pouch that makes the pouch bigger. One of the problems we had was that it didn't came with a water bag. We were a little sad to see this, but luckily we had one from another pack that worked fine.
review.name: The wife loves it!

review.reviewBody: I wanted a light and compact backpack for short day trips to the city and hikes. Fits all my needs. It's comfortable to wear and I also like that there are zipped up pockets on the straps allowing easy access to my phone
review.name: Perfect compact backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great little pack for a weekend excursion or just carrying around the necessities for two young children (4 and 6). Will fit their two 12oz water bottles, snacks and light sweatshirts. Love the chest strap and the two chest pockets - one for my phone and one for tissues. I'm 5'3" 120 lbs and the women's version definitely fit more comfortably than the mens.
review.name: Great little pack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just bought this and thought I would love it. Used this pack for one 9 mile day hike on the Appalachian Trail and the side pocket elastic broke from storing water bottle. Returning.
review.name: Not Worth It

review.reviewBody: I'm fairly petite and often find backpacks are too big for me...this pack fits great (I ordered a couple different packs and this is the one I kept). I specifically bought it for a trip to Europe to use on the plane and when out and about. It fit everything I needed and I appreciated the multiple pockets for organizing. Only one of the side pockets will hold a water bottle since one is too short (24oz owala fit perfect, 32oz hydro flask was a tighter fit). I liked how the zippers for the largest two compartments could hide behind the water bottle to be less conspicuous while traveling and I was also able to use a small cable lock on them. My 15" hp laptop doesn't fit in the laptop pocket inside the pack, but does fit loose in the main compartment.
review.name: Perfect size for travel.

review.reviewBody: Lightweight and spacious, meets my needs perfectly. Love the dedicated compartments for sunglasses and tablet, and small zippered front pouch. Water bottle holder is actually big enough to hold a bottle, unlike my other small backpacks. Black with rose details is super cute.
review.name: Perfect small backpack

review.reviewBody: Bought for daughter, holds all her school books. Is comfortable to wear when weighted down. Great for long walks/hikes.
review.name: I would buy this again and again!

review.reviewBody: Great for school and it has a convenient cpu area that is secure
review.name: School Friendly

review.reviewBody: The backpack is very well made, has many pockets, looks very stylish and holds everything my daughter needs as she starts college.
review.name: Great booksack

review.reviewBody: I purchased this for everyday use as a bag to take my laptop and belongings to work. I walk to and from work and I wanted to replace a tote bag so that the weight would be balanced on my shoulders during my short walk. I anticipate using this bag to carry items while traveling and hiking.
review.name: I love this backpack

review.reviewBody: Awesome bag.!! Looks so stylish and can be use at work bag!!!
review.name: I would buy it again.

review.reviewBody: I use this women specific to travel back and forth internationally. It accommodates my laptop with tons of storage to boot. The woman specific design makes it comfortable on my shoulders and back. I have had problems with other backpacks that were not meant for women, with pain and fatigue. I bought this backpack to replace an old one that I just wore out with years of use. I would not buy another brand of backpack, and couldn't be happier with the fit and usability.
review.name: Buying a second North Face Woman Specific Backpack

review.reviewBody: I love this backpack! It's the perfect size and the color is a bonus!
review.name: Love Love Love

review.reviewBody: I recently used the Women's Isabella Backpack 3.0 for air travel, and it was a great choice. The backpack is compact enough to fit under the airplane seat, but still has plenty of space for all my essentials. I appreciated the multiple compartments, which made it easy to keep everything organized, and the padded straps were comfortable to wear, even during long travel days. Overall, it's a practical and reliable option for anyone looking for a travel-friendly backpack.
review.name: Perfect for air travel

review.reviewBody: The elastic band inside the gator is too flimsy. One my first trip, one broke while I was putting the gator on my boot and the second also broke during my first hike.
review.name: Not fit for purpose

review.reviewBody: Really durable gaters. The rubber band under the gater broke but I used them on a 24h long volcanic hike. I wish I could get a new rubber
review.name: Great gaiters

review.reviewBody: They are a little difficult to put on and take off but they work good once on. They have kept rocks, seeds, sand and other debris out of my shoes and off my socks on my last two cross-country hikes. They stay up fine and I have not needed velcro to keep them in place on my shoes.
review.name: They work

review.reviewBody: The stitching which holds the elastic band broke on first use. The way they stitch the elastic band, after a closer look, is weak just a few threads holding it.
review.name: Broke on first use

review.reviewBody: These are perfect for trail running, especially with shoes that have velcro in the back. I find that the mid strap is not needed when the velcro and hook is in use, but I love that the strap is an option. These are tall enough to protect the ankles during trail running but light for fast runs. There is a minimalist brand of gaiters popular with trail runners -- these are like them but more coverage, and more versatile with the strap and adjustment options. My only nitpick would be that the solid black version looks great, but the multi-colored options are not for me.
review.name: Perfect Minimalst Gaiters for Trail Running

review.reviewBody: Have only run once with these, but it was 7 trail miles in 12" of fresh snow, and they functioned perfectly. I did choose to put them on the shoe first which wasn't really a big deal. Reading about the durability of strap is worrisome but so far they are great. They must fit small because I was gifted these from someone that bought for their hiking boots, I use with runners.
review.name: So far, they are great

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) These are smaller than they look in the picture - meaning they are light, but also a bit awkward to get on over shoes. Work well to keep sticks out of shoes. We haven't had any rain in ages, so don't know about water resistance...
review.name: Not sure yet if they are worth it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Quick to put on does exactly what you want. I prefer the shorter ones for sure! Just enough coverage to keep rocks out of the shoes
review.name: Love!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These almost made it. Compared to the super UL gaiters OR made +5 years ago...these can't compare. Looking at these on their own, I like the ankle elastic. The light colored fabric in the front dirt stained with the first use. The understrap worked well in the scree and rocks, but was almost impossible to get off at the end of the day. Now I know why so many people broke the cording- they had to to get their shoes off. The overdone hook that "locks" onto the cord is totally unnecessary, I had to turn into a contortionist to flip it totally on its side just to unhook it. There is no getting your shoe off until that strap comes off! O/R needs to change the velcro to have the hook side on the fabric! Guy's, with the hook side on the shoe it will fill up with debri and dirt and not function (didn't anyone test this?). I "fixed" my pair. All my shoes have the "soft" patch on them and I have never had a problem that way. The O/R way, everyone has a problem with them. All in All, after having to file down the hooks to make them useable and reversing the velcro these will work just fine, but why should I have to remake them when it would have been so easy to start with?
review.name: Could have been great

review.reviewBody: The straps under shoe broke on first hike with both of the gaiters - weird that this was even developed.
review.name: Strap broke in 1 hour

name: Ferrosi Hybrid Gaiter

review.reviewBody:
This baselayer/hoody was one of the best pieces of active clothing I've owned, until I did my laundry...

DO NOT PUT THIS IN THE DRYER or it will shrink into something that a child would wear. The diamond knit of the fabric completely closed up and the seams have bunched up into ribbons. I've never had any problems washing merino wool garments so this was an unfortunate surprise.

My baselayer is completely ruined which is a huge dissapointment. DO NOT BUY THIS without understanding this piece of information. The tags say to handwash and hang dry so if that's something you're up for then go for it because it's truly a great piece of clothing.
review.name: WILL SHRINK INTO SIZE FOR CHILD

review.reviewBody: I've been riding a lotta years, and have used many base layers over the duration. This is the best one. I like it so much I bought a second! I use it under a regular jersey on cool days. I also wear this running in the winter. Great fit, great breathability and look. Highly recommend!
review.name: My Favorite Baselayer

review.reviewBody:
Not sure why someone would want something that goes so far down into bibshorts/tights but if you do, or you're really tall and thin, this might be good for you.

Pretty nice but unusable for me so returned.
review.name: Too long

review.reviewBody: This shirt is exceptionally well made.  However, if you are more of a USA sized boy (like me) the Castelli sizes have gone crazy teeny tiny....  I ordered an XL and this is 5-6" shorter in the torso than a 10 year old Craft of similar use.  It is a trend we all need to be aware of.  Solid Castelli quality, but sizing is nowhere near what other brands are running.  As a reference, CC had me purchase a 2XL long sleeve winter jersey and its PERFECT.  ***I am 5'10" and weight 180-185 with a swimmer build as your reference
review.name: Castelli cool weather

review.reviewBody: Great quality base layer for cycling. Extremely warm and ventilated in all the right spots. Make sure you size up in all the top layers made by Castelli.  I own base layers from most of the top companies, and Castelli's quality and features are superior. It is cut short in the front like a cycling jersey, so do not buy for snow mountain related sports. I wish I was able to find ski base layers of this quality.
review.name: Great Quality / Cycling Only

review.reviewBody: this thing is pretty nice.  Went on a brisk ride and was surprised that while it kept me warm, also had some breath-ability in it.  I would say it runs true to size, I'm 5'9" 165 athletic build 41" chest and this fit well.  A little long in the arms but I also tried the XL and it was a little baggy
review.name: glad I listened to the reviews

review.reviewBody:
Has been my go-to either above Assos base/skin layer or solo underneath Assos or Castelli jacket. Wicks great and adds the warmth and comfort I need in the 30s and low 40s. 

Not gonna lie, have also found myself wearing it as a casual base layer under a hoody in cooler weather - also perfect casual top above thin T-shirt.
review.name: Love it:

name: Flanders Warm Long-Sleeve Baselayer - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Alpine Start Hooded Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket. It's the perfect combination of breathability, compressability and some weather protection for my needs. I do high-output hikes/runs that last anywhere from 1-8 hours. This jacket compresses enough that I'll bring it along every time.  It breathes better than the Patagonia Houdini that I used once and found to be quite clammy.  I haven't been caught out in any unexpected weather, yet, but I'd expect the softshell fabric to offer enough protection in clouds, fog, or a light drizzle. It is pretty expensive, as is most of the stuff I buy from Black Diamond.  But their stuff just works for me, and is very much worth the price (loyal Black Diamond customer for over 30 years).
review.name: Ultralight softshell

review.reviewBody:
Small tweaks from S22 to S23.
S22 has waste drawstring. 
S22 underarm gussets are a bit more pronounced
S23 has an improved chest pocket
S23 has a slightly baggier fit

Personally I went with the S22. Depending on fit, YMMV and prefer the S23. 

Also, MSRP is $25 too expensive for what the garment offers. 

Love it for for ski touring, running and packable travel. Use it more than my less breathable more wind resistant lighter weight peers on the shelf (Houdini, Squamish, etc). However, when venturing into the alpine find myself more confident in wind/wet weather resistance of LTW shells like Distance & Squamish
review.name: Compared to the S22 version

review.reviewBody: A great piece of kit from Black Diamond for a lightweight back up jacket, but not worth the full price or sale price I paid for it. Great packed away as utilitarian minimalist piece, but with only one chest pocket it's not good enough to double around town. I am annoyed every time I look for hand pockets to put something in
review.name: Not enough jacket for the price

name: Alpine Start Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) Done a couple of 6-hour, Vancouver, BC, summer hikes in these and I love them! They're super light, comfortable and quick drying. I'm really enjoying the elastic waistband. It does have a tiny pocket on one side, but I wish it had bigger pockets on each side. Other than that, it's perfect.
review.name: Great shorts!

review.reviewBody: I have run 3-5miles 3x in these shorts and have to say the only, yet major drawback, is the tightness of the waistband. I really like the fabric, it is soft and flowy. The fit and inseam length are great, with the shorts staying put while in motion - no creeping up the thighs or backside. The waistband is narrow and uncomfortably tight. I am thinking of cutting a slit in the side of elastic to see if it will be more comfortable. I am 5'1" and 110lbs with athletic thighs. I tried on both the S & XS, and kept the XS as the S were too large / droopy for me.
review.name: Too tight waist band

review.reviewBody: First off, this bag uses tabs instead of a zipper. It's a pretty terrible system for cooler weather as it leaves huge gaps. I also don't see how it can be rated for 40 degrees F. It was barely sufficient for 60. The only decent feature is the size, but for the price, there have to be better options. I'm just glad I tested it out before taking it on a backpacking trip.
review.name: Poor product and misleading specs

review.reviewBody: Most of the reviews point to thin top but after using it   Warm weather desert did fluff a little more like a quilt has lot lot room to move then a mummy and it has only. A couple fastened points. no zipper at all to close more like a quilt not bad for warm muggy or. Warm dry nights like in desert in warm months
review.name: Good DESERT BAG IN WARMER WEATHER.

review.reviewBody: very thin, description is misleading. I would only use this at 60F and above.
review.name: Garbage: Don't Waste Your Money

review.reviewBody: I was excited to get this sleeping bag for summer camping. I pulled it out of the tiny sleeping bag case, which is like the size of a 2 Liter bottle of soda and rolled it out. I pried to fluff it up, but I was very disappointed at how thin the insulation is. Saying that there is insulation on the top of this is an overstatement, as you can see from the attached pictures. NO INSULATION AT ALL. Maybe there was a manufacturing issue. I would only feel comfortable sleeping in this bag if it was 70 outside.
review.name: BAD BAG! Top is  ~1/64th inch thick.
comment:
Hey there Bryan! 

I'm sorry to hear that this sleeping bag was not what you were expecting. I do see that you set up a return, I'll follow up with you via email to see if you would like to set up an exchange for something else. 

Cheers

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair at a local store and I really like them so I ordered a second pair from backcountry. I was disappointed when I opened the package and found a used pair with no tags. I processed a return immediately when I saw them.
review.name: Sent a used pair

review.reviewBody: These are great pants. Very durable, comfortable, and well-designed. My only note is that they run quite a bit small, even compared to other Kuhl pants. Usually I wear Klassik fit 32x32, but I need to size up to a 33x32 in these.
review.name: Great pants, but run very small

review.reviewBody: The snap/buckle on these and zippers are awful. Kuhl has the ability to make a great product but has missed the mark. The buckle continues to come undone for no reason and the zipper has broken on 2 pairs. I am a size 34x32.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody:
One pair of my Rydr pants had the frequently mentioned snap problem--so I never really wore them.  I finally contacted Kuhl, they replied immediately with a free UPS shipping label, and then completed a repair of my pants within a few days of receiving them.  Much much faster service then Patagonia, at zero cost.

John L.
review.name: FYI

review.reviewBody: Have had 2 pairs. Both have color spots and fades after first wash. Snap does not stay closed. Both pairs were marked the same size, second pair is a size smaller on waist and length. I like Kuhl products but the Ryder pants and poor quality.
review.name: Too many things that do not work.

review.reviewBody: The fabric, features, and fit (albeit relaxed) is great. The snap at the waist does not stay closed. I have to bend at the waist and move and the snap comes open. I have a few pairs of Kuhl shorts and they have a French Fly which helps take the strain off the zipper/snap. I am looking elsewhere.
review.name: Want to love this pant

review.reviewBody: Love Kuhl pants have have multiple pairs of Rydrs I have ordered over the years.  I have always gotten the same size.  The last three pairs I have bought have all had different variations in sizing.  The first pair was tighter than one's I have bought in the past and the last two pairs have retained that slimmer fit but also have gotten longer in the inseam.
review.name: Kuhl changed its sizing

review.reviewBody: These are perfect for me.  I wear them all the time.   I quit wearing jeans  and these are my everyday, work, and church wear.   Yes, the dye fads differently.   Thats by design.    Im looking to expand on my color array.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: The snap on these pants is absolutely useless.  I wear these pants occasionally to change the oil in my truck because I cannot bring myself to toss them in the trash because they cost so much and I would not want to put a thrift store shopper thru this.  When I do wear them I am snapping the snap all day long.  The crotch area has been annoyingly enlarged and looks really funny when you walk.  My neighbor tried to give me his pair because he refused to wear them and I refused to take them.  5'11' 175, 32x32...not a hard fit for most pants manufacturers.  No way I am posting a picture...you will make fun of me.
review.name: Most expensive and worst pants I own.

name: Rydr Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love this backpack! The green color is stunning, super lightweight and comfortable. The size is great, not too big or too small. Highly recommend!
review.name: Great backpack!

review.reviewBody: One of the best backpack I ever got. Love it!! Super comfortable and easy to wear best for day hikes. I have  the 2L water tank too and it is perfect with this back pack. I really recoomended.
review.name: One of the best backpack I ever got. Love it!!

review.reviewBody: Went hiking through the Highlands in Scotland (day hikes, nothing overnight). This backpack was perfect! It held everything I needed and more. It was lightweight and the perfect gear for the trip.
review.name: Great Hiking Bag

review.reviewBody:
I have had my trailblazer 10 for a couple of years and it is my favorite go to bag for cycle commuting. I love: the fit, straps are minimal but fit well and breath well, I removed the waist belt and yet that pack stays nicely put while Im riding, the profile is low and sleek without unnecessary extra straps and dangling things. 
Its simple and its small, its a small 10l bag, other manufacturers would probably rate this as a slightly smaller volume. This works for me as I dont want a massive bag on me when Im on my road bike, I can fit a change of clothes, bike kit and a few extra things but Im constrained to the essentials. Side pockets can easily fit snacks and a bike water bottle. 
This pack is crazy lite weight, another massive +. 
I have left off a star as the colour is fading (I bought the pack in red and its starting to show its age) i have washed it a couple of time on gentle (against instructions, it says dont wash!?) and that might be partly responsible but it looks like UV fading, I ride with it a lot in the summer. Not a deal breaker for me, its well used and well loved, awesome kit!
review.name: Perfect road cycling backpack

review.reviewBody: bought it for day hikes, and it's been incredibly versatile and convenient. There's plenty of space to carry everything I need, and I absolutely love it!
review.name: Great product!

name: Trailblazer 10L Hydration Pack

review.reviewBody: Great hat! My three year old loves it and I love that it protects him from the sun!
review.name: Great hat.

review.reviewBody: These are our favorite hats! We got our first play hat when my little one was 10 months and it still fits him at almost 3 with the adjustable tab at the back. The brim and coverage is the best for our Arizona sun. Now we have 3 Sunday Afternoon hats for him- one for school, one for home and one for grandmas house!
review.name: Love!

review.reviewBody:
I bought this for my granddaughter and its been great! Great sun coverage while playing in the sun and on the beach. Covers down on the neck so no sun burn.
I bought a size large and it fits and big 4 year old great.  Hoping to get another year out of it as well.
review.name: Great Hat

review.reviewBody: Great print and fit. My 4 year old likes wearing it and it doesnt slip on his head even when he is playing in the water. 10/10 would buy again
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I was thrilled to find a hat that fits my head and looks terrific.  I love how the neck guard can tuck up under the adjustable head strap.  The service was great.
review.name: Fits my adult head perfectly!

review.reviewBody: We got this hat when our LO was just an infant and loved it for all outdoor activities as it is lightweight, washable and durable. One day she threw it out of her stroller, so we had to get another one. We bought the exact same one, she is 2.5 now and we are getting the next size up, these hats are PRIMO! I recommend them to everyone!
review.name: The BEST hats for kiddos

review.reviewBody: This is only hat my daughter wore from 8 months to 5 years. She was a big asian baby and wore size small which is adjustable till the age 5. Now, I have just put an order for size L. It is light, low maintenance, and above all, it's the only hat my child would tolerate on her head.
review.name: The best hat all around!

hasVariant.description: Buy the ENVE SES Aero Road Stem online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
So I picked this up mainly as a fashion piece to complete the Enve Aero cockpit, which is silly, but I figured why not. So it looks great, but I really had no expectations as far as improving ride quality.

First off, it's stiff. Is it stiffer than a basic aluminum stem? Hard telling, but I have a pretty strong sprint and it feels super solid. For $300, that's a reasonable expectation for a stem.

The surprise was how much chatter it cut out. I usually struggle with numbness in my hands on long stretches of chip seal and other buzzy surfaces, but it completely cut it out. I can't say enough about how much it smoothed out my ride.

Also, the flexibility in fit adjustments allow you to set a more aggressive stem angle and add another spacer, which might make the bike easier to sell in the future with a bit of extra length on the steerer tube (unless you're rocking the slammed stem with the -17 shim).
review.name: Great stem

name: SES Aero Road Stem

review.itemreviewed: High Wasted Print Midi Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: I want to love these, but I only like them. The color is beautiful and the reason I bought them. The fabric also feels soft and nice, not too thin and not too thick, however the fit is problematic. I am 5'4 130 pounds and I bought a small which is my regular size in yoga pants across brands. When I initially tried them on they seemed to fit fine, so I removed the tags and wore them. They kept sagging in the crotch and I had to pull them up to my bra line trying to keep them hiked up. The crotch area also fit tightly to the body so it kind of billows out around the area of the front thigh crevice. I am constantly needing to hike them up. I would have exchanged for an X-Small if I hadn't removed the tags. It doesn't seem there would be a size small enough for a very petite woman.
review.name: I want to love these,

review.reviewBody: I have one pair of these in grey cropped for about 2 years and have been wanting a second one. Their softness and quality has kind of amazed me. Im a medium usually or a 8/10, but the size chart put me at a Large though my last pair is a medium. The large still hugs me and is not baggy or excess fabric anywhere like some leggings when I go up a size. These are still the softest leggings Ive ever put on. Love this green color.

review.itemreviewed: High Wasted Print Midi Legging - Women's
review.reviewBody: The XL in these were like compression pantyhose compared to the XL I bought in the SpaceDye jumpsuit with the built in bra. My husband and I were amazed at the difference in size when you hold up the XL in this pant, vs the XL in the jumpsuit. It doesn't dig into my waist, though, and the colors and fabric are luxurious. I hope the inner thigh seam doesn't pill and pin-hole through from the stress the seams are taking. I have no problems with the jumpsuit I bought, but like I said, these are not as roomy as the legs of the XL jumpsuit. Despite the stretch, it doesn't appear to be straining the fabric at first wear. I bent over, and my husband couldn't see any thinning in the fabric. I'll keep them, just get a 1X in the regular tights if I reorder, because if they're that tight and thick, the 1X isn't going to be loose or baggy; it'll just have more material and put less stress on the seams.
review.name: XL was like a size Med/Large

name: High Wasted Print Midi Legging - Women's

review.reviewBody: Im disappointed with  this bib, the cargo pocket flaps are  tight  and  not  easy to use,  super  difficult  to get  things or food out during a  gravel or mtb  ride, worse for  a  race. The Pad, look confortable but the front side is not  well done,  always bothers  me, is not  confortable in the front, almost close to make  a injure!. And the reason to  buy it: drop-tail bib...careful doesnt   work  well, the competitors bibs are much much better and well designed.. Really  sad, because   I had use a lot of Castelli bibs for mtb endurance races  and never had a problem, but this  model  is not working well at least   for  gravel rides 40 miles or more. And now a days  we deserve just designs with drop tail but  well done!!!. Usually   I think  they and Castelli   have the  best pads, but in this model is particularly uncomfortable in the front.
review.name: Not  the best  pad or  cargo pockets

review.reviewBody: I love these shorts. They fit great and are super comfy. But, I cannot recommend them because the stitching on the chamois came undone after 3-4 months of use. This is my second pair of these shorts. I had the same thing happen to my first pair after about a year. I hoped it was a one off problem but it is not. If you know your way around a sewing machine you can fix the problem, but it shouldnt come to that
review.name: Poor Workmanship

review.reviewBody: This is my first pair of nice bibs and I was impressed. I've been riding Terry Cycles shorts for years, and the padding in these bibs felt like an extra saddle. Absorbed so much road chatter and was very very comfortable. The sizing is unfortunate. I ordered the XL and they fit great, but my normal size is M-L in other areas of clothing. The cargo pocket is pretty nice, very secure.
review.name: Luxury feel

name: Unlimited Cargo Bib Short - Women's

description: Buy the Helinox Cot One Convertible - Insulated online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Cot One Convertible - Insulated
hasVariant.description: Buy the Helinox Cot One Convertible - Insulated online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The idea of an integrated sleeping pad really intrigued me, so I took the plunge and purchased the Insulated Cot 1.  Problem: the cot failed to self-inflate even after 24 hours leaving the inflation port open (and deflation port closed).  I was able to inflate it, with some effort, using a Sea-to-Summit inflation bag.  Left it overnight to allow the foam to expand, then deflated the pad and tried the self-inflation routine again.  Nope, didn't fill up after another full 24 hours.  I tried pressing on the inflation valve, as shown on the image next to the valve.  That ended up dislodging the valve flap, which disappeared inside the mat.   That's not the performance I expected from a $500 piece of camping gear.  Thankfully,  the Backcountry rep (Samuel E.) I chatted with did a wonderful job arranging an exchange that's supposed to arrive in time for an upcoming trip.  I'll refine my review after testing out the replacement.  Fingers crossed, 'cuz this bit of gear could be a game changer........or not.
review.name: Faulty Inflatable Pad

name: Cot One Convertible - Insulated

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent waterproof storage bag that includes a viewing window ...Nice!!
review.name: nice water bag .. with a view Window!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The convenience of these lightweight bags are simple yet effective! Easy to use, carry and store away! Only time will tell if the overall sturdiness can hold up. Your accessory strap is also a nice addition.
review.name: See-thru waterproof lightweight bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used it kayaking out and around the channel islands last weekend. Snacks stayed dry and easy to access/see what's in the bag during breaks.
review.name: Snacks stayed dry kayaking.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] On my recent national park trip I was able to use this dry bag. This doesnot come with the dry bag sling. 5L is a good size to carry a couple of different items. The oval base makes it easy to load items. The clear window prevents unnecessary openings. I did some water crossings and this bag kept my electronics safe and dry. I plan to take this product for future hiking trip. Would recommend.
review.name: Works as expected

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag is perfect for any outing. Holds quite a bit. We take it out to the pool, to the water park, and camping. We use it to keep our phones and keys wallets etc. Dry and protected from the elements. Note: it is NOT water proof.
review.name: Great little dry bag.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag is the perfect size for my kids swim clothes. Its easy to use and I feel at ease using it for our kayak trip. I originally had food inside. No leak. No nothing. Very simple yet stylish. Will buy again.
review.name: Very light and useful!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sea to summit 8 liter bag is great to keep things dry. Easy to use and follow directions. Nice size to keep necessities in. Sea thru front is a great feature so you can easily see what is inside without having to reopen.
review.name: Great bag.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This 8 liter bag is the perfect size for a day adventure. Fits my essential electronics, GoPro, phone, backup battery, as well as an extra shirt and pair of shorts. The window is a nice touch. I love this bag, hopefully it'll last quite a while!
review.name: Well made and the perfect size

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I brought this bag with me on a trip to the beach and while I went kayaking and both time all of my belongings have stayed dry throughout the entire trip. I like the fact it has a viewing area to see what you are reaching for when you put your hand in the bag. I used it to put my phone in to see who is calling me. This bag also fits quite a bit of items in it.
review.name: Great dry bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This dry bag is the perfect size to bring in a kayak or to the beach. It holds My phone and wallet and keys and still has room for other things. I could even roll up a shirt and put inside. Eclipse closed and can hang from my kayak or my beach bag. It keeps everything dry.
review.name: Great

description: Buy the MSR Strike Igniter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Strike Igniter
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Strike Igniter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
A very reliable fire starter. Certainly on the more expensive side, but high quality. 

I noticed some people complained about not being able to use the striker efficiently. In my experience its much easier to use the back of a knife blade or saw blade on a Leatherman or SAK as the striker. It works much better.
review.name: Decent fire starter.

review.reviewBody: I get a spark once in a while, but no way would I rely on this when I need to get warm and fed ASAP, cold and or tired.
review.name: Just unreliable for my skill level

review.reviewBody: For when you want n windy conditions and need that light!
review.name: A must have

review.reviewBody:
really nice striker - the cord is great so what you done loose the two parts & the magnet holding them together is a very cleaver design. This is a little heavier then others & I feel like the 'bottle opener' could use a redesign, maybe into a can opener? 

That said, this is the igniter I reach for most often when packing for a trip. Highly recommended.
review.name: nice striker

review.reviewBody: they claim you can use it with the MSR wind burner, but it will only light this stove about one out of 10 strikes , which is unfortunate.
review.name: they claim you can use

review.reviewBody:
This is a backup to the one I already own. Two is one and one is none!! 

Ive used my first one many times and was able to ignite dried grass,wood chips and a feather stick. Another good kindle is cotton ball covered in vaseline. 

I like that its compact,lite and the striker is tethered. I used this when I went to Northern Nevada,Utah,Idaho,Montana and Wyoming. Especially came in handy in Idaho when it snowed in the middle of June!! Started many fires and also my backpack stove. This is an item I highly recommend. 

I have other msr equipment and been very happy with the quality of msr products. In fact I still have the alpine kitchen set since 2001. Ive added a msr plate and cooking pan to the alpine set and all nestle together and fit in the carry sack. I also bought a msr fork, spoon and knife to take when I go backpacking, hunting and camping.
review.name: This is a backup to

review.reviewBody: good striker, I like the extra length in the cord allows freer movement while lighting stove.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody:
only one side creates the little fire light. The other side is useless...I really can't start a fire with that side. I guess that side is supposed to be a beer opener, but it is also hard to open a beer.

Alcohol increases higher chance of mountain sickness in high altitude, so I don't drink when I am there. Hopefully this two sticks don't fail me in a raining day when I need to start fire to boil water.
review.name: only one side

review.reviewBody: Perfect size and easy to use. No worries about getting that fire started when needed.
review.name: Simple and reliable spark.

review.reviewBody: I prefer this over matches or a lighter because it ignites my stove in all weather conditions
review.name: I would buy this product again and again!

name: Strike Igniter

review.reviewBody: This shirt is incredibly comfortable and fits just right. I didn't notice any odor like another reviewer mentioned. I liked it so much that I ended up purchasing it in another color as well.
review.name: GREAT SHIRT

review.reviewBody: I purchased this for my husband -it was on sale pricing, and upon opening the plastic wrap from my backcountry order, this denim had an overpowering stench which I thought was warehouse smell. I cut the tags and hung it outside in sunlight for 24 hours, then brought it to the laundry room. It made my entire laundry room smell Immediately like the garmin dye process, or like a mattress off -gassing. I could not believe it. I washed it in a hot cycle with vinegar, hung to dry. Stilled smelled. Washed again with oxi clean. Still smelled, still put it outside. Even upon ironing it steamed this strange fowl odor. Its in the closet hanging up now, and for the life of me I still dont know why a $98 dollar denim shirt would be giving off so much of a strange toxic like odor. Disappointed experience will not purchase Howler Products in the future. My other garments from my order where normal.
review.name: Manufacture strange odor.

review.reviewBody: Very cozy, I love the colors that pop. I can see my girl running around with these colors because she wont blend in.
review.name: Perfection!

review.reviewBody: Got this as a gift for my godson. Super warm and cozy. Material is good quality
review.name: Love It

review.reviewBody: Classic, lighter weight fleece that washes super easy. Kid you not I've washed and dried this jacket at least 10x in a month & it still looks like I bought it for my 2 year old yesterday. As my little boy gets older, I plan on buying the next size up until I have to switch to the youth version and then I'll do the same until I switch to the adult version.

review.reviewBody: Really soft and really cool colors. However the zipper is very difficult for an adult to sometimes zip up. It gets stuck constantly to the point where my daughter doesn't want to wear it.
review.name: Zipper defective on new jacket

review.reviewBody: I get a Glacier fleece for my son every time grows up a size. They are great for the beatings he puts them through and the many washes the fleece endures. A tad pricier than others on the market but you get that back in the quality and longevity of the fleece.
review.name: Great kids fleece

review.reviewBody: I love this hoodie on my two boys and I did go up a size because I know it will shrink when I wash it. This is a great sweater to grab and go!
review.name: Great sweater!

review.reviewBody: Brought for youngest son!!!ll loves the texture and color!!!
review.name: Always pick North Face!!!

review.reviewBody: My granddaughter loves her new hoodie which replaces her smaller one.
review.name: Kid's Glacier Full zip Hoodie

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket, only problem I had was the sizing being so off compared to their toddler rain jacket. The 2t rain jacket was quite big on my child so I went with a 2t for this jacket thinking it'd be a little big but it barely fits her.

review.reviewBody: This is the cutest jacket for my daughter! She loves the colors and wants to wear it all the time. Great weight for chilly mornings.
review.name: Love this jacket!
