review.reviewBody:
You cant don and doff these full zip pants with both feet on the ground. You cant don and doff these pants while keeping skis on, crampons on, or boots on. All because the end of both zippers are closed. Even if just one end of one zipper was open (like the main zip on the parka) this would all be possible and you could don these at a moments notice. I dont know if this is a critical oversight or misguided design. It is very unfortunate that a small choice (a millimeter sized area) had such a large impact on functionality, on an otherwise well made and well designed garment. 

For those having trouble visualizing without owning the pants, there are 6 zippers, you can move them all to the end of one pant leg (where the cuff remains closed and wont accept a boot), all to the other pant leg (same), all to the top mid back whered youd have to try to climb in to the pants on the ground from the suspender side, or anywhere in between. There are always zips holding the two sides closed, despite the garment being one piece anyway, no matter where you move the zips. This inability for the zipper to detach at least at one end is what prevents these from being put on like a jacket and zipped up in place boots and all. Full zip pants without full zip functionality.
review.name: Cant don and doff with boots on despite the full zip

review.reviewBody: Living in central Alaska, these get worn frequently. And the durability seems really good. I havent had a an opportunity to take some below -20 yet. But the ability to open them and ventilate them its really great when you start working hard on the steep uphills.  I havent had to put a shell over them and they seem to block wind well with a matching jacket on Ive been in windchill temps below -40 and been really comfortable.
review.name: Great cold-weather choice

review.reviewBody: The Absolute Zero Pants are exactly what I wanted for winter around Fairbanks, Alaska. We experience lower than -50F with wind chill and therefore I was looking for expedition pants. The pants feature extremely dip pockets, the picture measures almost 13in which is deep enough for my expedition mittens. Additionally being able to zip open the rear is extremely useful when trying to use the restroom, especially in a dry cabin with no heat. The bib upper is comfortable and has two chest pockets big enough for your phone, batteries and snacks. The front two way zipper opens all the way. The back has six two way zippers that can be used to open the seat, undo the leg from the bottom to put the pants on and have a side vent open to release heat. At first the zippers are a little confusing since you first see four zippers all bunched up together and one zipper on each hem of the legs. You just need to practice to get familiar with the zippers. The velcro adjustable hems are not necessary for my double boots, but if you have smaller boots you can make it tighter. Even thought it is elastic and it also features two holes if you want to tie a cord to act as a boot gaiter and prevent the hem from rising in deep snow. Last winter, before I had these pants, I tried dry tooling (climbing with axes and crampons on rock free of ice/snow) at -30F and I was extremely cold from my legs while wearing synthetic belay pants. Thats when I realized I needed some serious expedition pants. I am excited to use the Absolute Zero Pants for the first time this winter and have no doubt they will withstand the coldest temperatures Ive experienced in Alaska.
review.name: Going to use for Alaska Paired with Phantom Parka

review.reviewBody: I was a little worried about sizing, but these ended up fitting like a glove. I have a 32" inseam and I wear 35" waist jean. Around my belly at the widest point I'm 40", and when I zip these up, they are comfortably snug ( I'm also packing an extra 5 or 10 lbs at the moment) They are super light and very well constructed. Good zippers. The chest packets are small, the front pockets are roomier an more useful. Suspenders are well constructed. I received these in summer so I can't attest to warmth, but walking around in my back yard, I can tell you they are easy to walk in, and afford a full range of motion. Judging by the loft, I'm pretty confident they'll be very warm.
review.name: Excellent Fit and Finish

review.reviewBody: Well, awesome; but, short legs.  I wear Mucks with Katoohlas usually so no exposure to Arctic weather; however, undeniable... "high water pants."
review.name: Arctic Circle Endorsed/Short Legs

review.reviewBody: The usual Mountain Hardwear product quality.  However, the legs of the pants are somewhat short, and thus, would benefit from "stirrups" at the leg ends.  Also, for the same reason, "snow skirts" inside the leg endings might help for use in deep snow.
review.name: Short Legs

name: Absolute Zero Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Shoe Color and comfort is really good. I got wide size range which is very comfortable, keeping my legs warm. Not having great grip on the ice but overall satisfying purchase.
review.name: Warm and stylish Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I purchased these for a hike. When I got them, I was not impressed with the comfort and worried that they would not be comfortable for the hike I was planning. So, I wore them for a few days, and they felt OK.
On my hike they started to hurt in the heel after the first mile. It got worse as the trail steepened. After about 5 miles my heels were blistered and popped.  I pushed on as to not hold up my group. It was great to start going downhill and take the pressure off my heel. After about a mile my toes were blistering. I used moleskin, but it was no help. I finished slow and now I don't even dare put them back on after it took over a week to heal.
These were a bad choice that I regret.
review.name: Blister boots

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Fit & quality is good. But if you are expecting "Color: Kettle, Nori" to look like a light tan or khaki with a little green towards the back then DO NOT BUY!. THESE ARE GREY. I even matched up the item # of website with the item on the shoes. THE PICTURE LOOKS NOTHING LIKE THE GREY BOOT YOU WILL RECEIVE. 
             Color: Kettle, Nori
review.name: Color: Kettle, Nori  IS A GREY COLOR NOT LIKE PIC!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these boots. I wear them for work. Standing all day and walking around while working. Very comfortable right out the box. Been wearing them for 7 yrs now. First wide pair and I'll buy them again in the brown and blue colors soon.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great shoe. They are comfy even with my foot issues
review.name: Been buying Columbia boots for 11 years now and to

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The good news is Ive owned several pairs of these boots. The bad news is that Ive owned several pairs of these boots. They are super comfortable right out of the box, lightweight, and waterproof. Great for hiking and walking the dog. Five star rating for that. Unfortunately, in my case, the rubber soles wear down to nothing in just a few months of wearing them two or three hours a day. The stitching and everything is great, but theres no tread left. If Columbia could make them last longer it would be a major improvement and I wouldnt be looking at other brands.
review.name: Comfortable but dont last

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good feel, sturdy but light, my feet always hurt but these have more support than my old go to boot
review.name: Nice boot

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus II Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these end of August last year. Excellent fit (really best fit of a hiking boot I have ever had) and kept my feet warm through the winter even during subzero temps. Walking a puppy 4 to 5 times a day, comfort is key and with having wider than normal feet, the fact these come WIDE is a HUGE plus. Soles lasted about 360 miles with half that walking in sand so typical range of at the price point and still usable. Definitely buying another pair soon.
review.name: Most comfortable hiking boot I have ever worn.

name: Newton Ridge Plus II Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
